result.execSummary:
The defendant Erik M. Garcia was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Credit for 46 days, if revoked.
Expunction hrg set for 2/23/17 @ 8:30am.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.
*   Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*   If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.
*   DE is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.
  May not have contact with victim unless allowed by agent after DV Counseling, unless otherwise permitted by the court/agent.  Not to drive w/o valid DL.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Erik M. Garcia

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Attorney Margaret Drees appeared for the State. Attorney J Fields-Bowers appeared on behalf of deft. Clerk/H. Barnett. Deft in custody but not brought over. Atty Fields-Bowers withdraws his motion for the court to reconsider the expunction petition. No action taken.

Attorney Zachary Brost appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney J Fields-Bowers, for Atty K Watson.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Fields-Bowers motion to reconsider the petition to expunge court record of conviction.  Court continues MH to 9/15/17 at 8:30am pending a decision from the Supreme Court.
e-mail from ADA Drees w/status report from DOC Agt Katie Brasure.

Attorney Jessica Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney J Fields-Bowers.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Fields-Bowers motion to reconsider the petition to expunge the court record of conviction.  ADA Krejcarek requests an adjournment for the probation agent to provide a list of any violations.  Court adjourns MH to 5/31/17 at 1:30pm; proof that the deft completed domestic violence counseling is to be provided.
to reconsider defense's petition to expunge court record of conviction; filed by Atty J Fields-Bowers.
Discharged from probation on 1/22/17

NO RECORD MADE.  Attorney Jessica Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Deft in custody but not brought over, was just arrested on a new charge yesterday.  No action taken on expunction, hearing will not be rescheduled.
Discharged on 1/22/17
Associated with Charge #1
Presentence incarceration credit.
of disposition of case; deft released from custody as to this file only.
Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge

Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney H Edwards, for Atty K Watson.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Deft pleads guilty.  Court finds deft guity.  PSI waived.  Court withholds sentence and places deft on probation for 1 year w/conditions concurrent to 15CF955; credit for 46 days served if revoked; deft to submit DNA sample and pay $250 DNA surcharge.  Expunction hearing set for 2/23/17 at 8:30am.
No disposition. Leave on for next scheduled court activity.

Defendant Erik M. Garcia appeared with Attorney Kristyne Alicen Watson.  Defendant in custody. Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk JThwing. Minutes:  Victim rights compliance.  DE waives preliminary hearing; probable cause found. Bound over to Br 6.  Information filed, reading waived. Not guilty pleas entered. Bond continued.  DA Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 15, 2016 at 01:30 pm.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 22, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary Hearing Waiver/Plea Offer
to Preliminary Hearing
